alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:25PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Norton, northern Decatur and southeastern Red Willow Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 425 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Danbury, or 9 miles north of Oberlin, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Norton, northern Decatur and southeastern Red Willow Counties, including the following locations... Reager and Cedar Bluffs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
